hauptsatz.name: Hauptsatz (Main Clause)
hauptsatz.description: A main clause can stand alone as a complete sentence. The conjugated verb is always in position 2.

rules.rule: Position 1: Subject or other element (time, place, object)
End: Infinitives, separable prefixes, past participles

nebensatz.name: Nebensatz (Subordinate Clause)
nebensatz.description: A subordinate clause depends on a main clause. The conjugated verb goes to the END of the clause.

rules.rule: Conjugated verb goes to the END
examples: Ich lerne Deutsch, weil es wichtig ist.
Er sagt, dass er müde ist.
Ich weiß nicht, ob er kommt.

rules.rule: Always use a comma before the conjunction
examples: Ich bleibe zu Hause, weil es regnet.
Er sagt, dass er krank ist.

exercises.question: Choose correct word order: Ich / heute / gehe / ins Kino
exercises.explanation: Normal word order: Subject (Ich) + Verb position 2 (gehe) + time (heute) + destination.

exercises.question: Choose correct word order: Heute / ich / fahre / nach Berlin
exercises.explanation: Inverted word order: Time (Heute) position 1 + Verb (fahre) position 2 + Subject (ich).

exercises.question: Complete: Ich bleibe zu Hause, weil es _____. (regnet)
exercises.explanation: In subordinate clause (weil), verb goes to the END. Subject (es) comes before the verb.

exercises.question: Complete: Er sagt, dass er müde _____. (ist)
exercises.explanation: In subordinate clause (dass), verb 'ist' goes to the END.

exercises.question: Question word order: du / Deutsch / lernst / ?
exercises.explanation: Yes/No questions: Verb (Lernst) first + Subject (du) + object.

exercises.question: Complete: Ich weiß nicht, ob er _____. (kommt)
exercises.explanation: In subordinate clause (ob), verb goes to the END.

exercises.question: Separable verb: Ich _____ um 7 Uhr _____. (aufstehen)
exercises.explanation: Separable prefix 'auf' goes to the end in main clause.

exercises.question: Modal verb: Ich _____ nach Hause _____. (will gehen)
exercises.explanation: Modal verb in position 2, infinitive at the end.

exercises.question: Choose: Ich gehe ins Kino, _____ der Film gut ist.
Complete subordinate clause: ..., weil ich keine Zeit _____. (habe)
exercises.explanation: Verb 'habe' goes to the end in subordinate clause with 'weil'.

flashcards.front: Where does the verb go in a Hauptsatz?
flashcards.explanation: In main clauses, the conjugated verb is ALWAYS in position 2.

flashcards.front: Where does the verb go in a Nebensatz?
flashcards.explanation: In subordinate clauses, the conjugated verb goes to the end.

flashcards.front: Fix: Ich heute gehe ins Kino
flashcards.explanation: Verb must be in position 2 in main clauses.

flashcards.front: Complete: Ich bleibe zu Hause, weil es _____
flashcards.explanation: Verb goes to the end after 'weil'.
